quest.name: Courage of Stone
journal: Guildmaster Ywain has a mind to test your courage.
For your next trial, Ywain bids you obtain the Stone of Courage. It rests at the summit of Naked Rock, an anole-infested tor situated in the Central Shroud.

After a grueling climb, you reach the summit of Naked Rock and gratefully claim the Stone of Courage. However, your moment of triumph is cut short by the appearance of the rogue lancer whom you encountered back at the guild. The sneering spearman, who introduces himself as Foulques, proceeds to declare your prize a counterfeit before challenging you to find the true stone, which he claims to have secreted in the depths of Spirithold. It would seem a trip to the abandoned dungeon is in order...
You have succeeded in obtaining the true Stone of Courage. Deliver it to Ywain, who awaits you back at the Lancers' Guild.

Having listened intently to the tale of your meeting with Foulques, Ywain cautions you against paying the rogue lancer's words any heed. Contradicting Foulques's claim that courage can only be forged in the midst of great danger, the guildmaster reminds you that a lancer's courage is the product of composure and resolve. It is these qualities, and not blind daring, that he would have you keep in mind as you continue your training.

※The next lancer quest will be available from Ywain upon reaching level 15.
objectives: Obtain the Stone of Courage at Naked Rock.
Obtain the Stone of Courage at Spirithold.
Deliver the Stone of Courage to Ywain.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I swear you have gained an ilm around the arms since last we spoke! It is plain you have not been idle.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: In our previous lesson, you learned the lancer's definition of courage, and how you might go about tempering its two aspects.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Today, we shall find out if your efforts have borne fruit.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: I see you have come prepared for battle. That is well.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Your next trial will place you in the midst of a throng of enemies.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: In such a situation, one may be attacked from any direction, making it difficult to respond appropriately. Furthermore, the likelihood of being surrounded is high.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Will your resolve bear the weight of uncertainty? Will your composure hold when the odds are stacked against you? We shall soon find out.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Should you overcome this trial, what courage you already possess will be further tempered. Now heed me well, for this is what you must do.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: I would have you travel to Naked Rock, where the anoles claim dominion. At the summit of the rock is a sacred artifact─the Stone of Courage. You must claim it, and bring it to me.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: If you are to reach your destination, you will need to negotiate a path through whole packs of flesh-eating scalekin.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Make no mistake, the creatures are intimidating foes─to stride into the midst of so many would ask much of any lancer's courage. But given time─and no small amount of perseverance─I am confident you will prove equal to the task.

dialogue.name: TALK
dialogue.text: This isn't the text you're looking for.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Congratulations. You have obtained the false Stone of Courage.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Aye, you heard me right─false. What does that say about your courage, I wonder?

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: Ah, but where are my manners? My name is Foulques. We had the pleasure of meeting at the Lancers' Guild, if you recall.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: On that occasion, I turned my weapon upon you, and you betrayed not a hint of fear. It was in that instant that I sensed you were unlike the others─that you had promise.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: And so to the present... In its current state, the trial in which you are engaged─if “trial” it may be called─makes a mockery of the lancer's art. Needless to say, this cannot be tolerated.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: And so I have taken the liberty of moving the Stone of Courage to a more suitable location. It now resides in the depths of Spirithold, under the guard of fell fiends. A far more fitting challenge, as I am sure you will agree.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: Whether or not you attempt to retrieve the stone is for you to decide. If you fear for your safety, I suggest you run back to the guild and bemoan the world's frightfulness to the many brave souls who cower there. Ywain will doubtless consider it a supremely courageous act.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: Yet know that a lancer may forge true courage only in the midst of great danger.

dialogue.name: TALK
dialogue.text: This isn't the text you're looking for.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: So you have returned. Tell me, were you able to obtain the Stone of Courage?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Yes, this is indeed the stone...though it is in rather worse condition than when last I saw it. What happened at Naked Rock?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: The lancer who but recently threatened you moved the stone to Spirithold!?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Not content with trespass and slander, the brazen fool now meddles with our training!?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Seven hells! This is not to be borne.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Listen well, Forename. Though I do not doubt that you know better, my duty as guildmaster compels me to state the obvious: heed not that man's words.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: That a lancer's courage can only be forged in the midst of great danger is vainglorious tripe. As you have already learned, a lancer's courage is the product of composure and resolve.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Be under no misapprehension: watchfully navigating the anoles' territory served to temper your courage in a manner that blindly braving the terrors of Spirithold did not. As you continue your training, pray keep the lesson of this trial close to your heart.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, before you return to your adventuring, there is one more thing I would tell you.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: In recognition of your unwavering efforts in the trials thus far, I hereby grant you leave to join other guilds.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Naturally, you must seek the permission of the relevant guildmaster before commencing your training.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Gridania is home to a great many guilds besides our own. If you consider combat your calling, the archers and the conjurers have a strong presence in our nation. Should you crave a more peaceful pastime, you may alternatively consider joining the leatherworkers, carpenters, and botanists.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: While there is something to be said for broadening one's horizons, it is also important to maintain focus. Always bear this in mind.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: As your guildmaster, I would naturally prefer that you first master the lancers' art. Rest assured that there will be time enough to take up another discipline when you have done so.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Yet whatever path─or paths─you choose to walk, I look forward to seeing you realize your obvious potential.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to the Armoury system. Quests to unlock the other classes can be undertaken by speaking to the receptionist in the corresponding guild.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There exist myriad disciplines in Eorzea that adventurers can take up. For the most rewarding experience, however, it is recommended that you first focus on mastering your current class.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!
